channel.title: 317 Pi Client Problem
channel.description:
Keep Getting This? Ive Set My PATH And CLASSPATH Correct
or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args...] (to execute a jar file) where options include: -d32 use a 32-bit data model if available -d64 use a 64-bit data model if available -client to select the "client" VM -server to select the "server" VM -hotspot is a synonym for the "client" VM [deprecated] The default VM is client.
-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files> -classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files> A ; separated list of directories, JAR archives, and ZIP archives to search for class files. -D<name>=<value> set a system property -verbose:[class|gc|jni] enable verbose output -version print product version and exit -version:<value> require the specified version to run -showversion print product version and continue -jre-restrict-search | -no-jre-restrict-search include/exclude user private JREs in the version search -? -help print this help message -X print help on non-standard options -ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] -enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] enable assertions with specified granularity -da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] -disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>] disable assertions with specified granularity -esa | -enablesystemassertions enable system assertions -dsa | -disablesystemassertions disable system assertions -agentlib:<libname>[=<options>] load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help -agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>] load native agent library by full pathname -javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>] load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument
-splash:<imagepath> show splash screen with specified image See http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/documentation/index.html for m ore details. Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: 317 Pi Client Problem
item.dc:creator: @CaZz_TaZz CaZz TaZz
item.description:
@CaZz_TaZz wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:18, topic:521857”] @echo off java -cp bin; client pause

I keep getting the compiler code confused with the initiate code. Sorry the the confusion.[/quote]

Oh My God, Its Working, Thank You

Read full topic

-d Is Unreconised

Unrecognized option: -d
Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.
Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

Where So Close

item.title: 317 Pi Client Problem
item.dc:creator: @CaZz_TaZz CaZz TaZz
item.description:
@CaZz_TaZz wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:6, topic:521857”]oops my bad, “javac” not “java”

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_21\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause[/quote]

javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . .

How Can It Not Be Found? :S

Here Is My Varibles

PATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_21\bin

CLASSPATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_21\bin

Read full topic

post your batch script

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_21\bin\java.exe” -cp *.Java
pause

item.title: 317 Pi Client Problem
item.dc:creator: @CaZz_TaZz CaZz TaZz
item.description:
@CaZz_TaZz wrote:

Keep Getting This? Ive Set My PATH And CLASSPATH Correct

or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)
where options include:
-d32 use a 32-bit data model if available
-d64 use a 64-bit data model if available
-client to select the “client” VM
-server to select the “server” VM
-hotspot is a synonym for the “client” VM [deprecated]
The default VM is client.

-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
-classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
              A ; separated list of directories, JAR archives,
              and ZIP archives to search for class files.
-D<name>=<value>
              set a system property
-verbose:[class|gc|jni]
              enable verbose output
-version      print product version and exit
-version:<value>
              require the specified version to run
-showversion  print product version and continue
-jre-restrict-search | -no-jre-restrict-search
              include/exclude user private JREs in the version search
-? -help      print this help message
-X            print help on non-standard options
-ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              enable assertions with specified granularity
-da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              disable assertions with specified granularity
-esa | -enablesystemassertions
              enable system assertions
-dsa | -disablesystemassertions
              disable system assertions
-agentlib:<libname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof
              see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help
-agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library by full pathname
-javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>]
              load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument

-splash:<imagepath>
              show splash screen with specified image

See http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/documentation/index.html for m
ore details.
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
